alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Hale (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:20PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Floyd and northeastern Hale Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Plainview, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Plainview, Aiken and Seth Ward. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
